package nov27;

import java.util.ArrayList;

public class EgArrayList {

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		// TODO Auto-generated method stub
		ArrayList<String> al=new ArrayList<String>();  
        System.out.println("Initial Elements in AL1: "+al); 
        
        //Adding elements to list  
        al.add("Element 1");  
        al.add("Element 2");  
        al.add("Element 3");  
        System.out.println("After Adding : "+al);
        
        //Removing elements from list    ( to remove all elements --> al.clear();
        al.remove("Element 2"); // or al.remove(1); 
        System.out.println("After Removing an element : "+al);
        
       
        //Adding at specific position  
        al.add(1, "Tamizh");   
        System.out.println("After Adding in specific Position "+al);  
        
        System.out.println("---------------");
        
        ArrayList<String> al2=new ArrayList<String>();
        al2.add("CSE");  
        al2.add("AI");
        System.out.println("Initial Elements in AL2: "+al2); 
        
        //Adding second list elements to the first list  
        al.addAll(al2);  
        System.out.println("After adding 2nd list to 1st list : "+al);  
        
        System.out.println("---------------");
        
        ArrayList<String> al3=new ArrayList<String>();  
        al3.add("PUBG");  
        al3.add("COC");  
        System.out.println("Initial Elements in AL3: "+al3); 
        
        //Adding second list elements to the first list at specific position  
        al.addAll(1, al3);  
        System.out.println("After adding 3rd list to 1st list at specific position : "+al);  
        
        System.out.println("---------------");
        
        //retainALL  - It removes everything from the current list except the elements that match the given collection.
        
        ArrayList <String> al4 = new ArrayList<String>();
        al4.add("A");  
        al4.add("B");  
        al4.add("C"); 
        
        System.out.println("Elements in AL4: "+al4); 
                
        ArrayList <String> al5=new ArrayList<String>();  
        al5.add("D");  
        al5.add("E");
        al5.add("F");
        System.out.println("Elements in AL5: "+al5); 
        
        al4.addAll(al5);
        System.out.println("");
        System.out.println("Elements in AL4 after adding AL5: "+ al4);
        al4.retainAll(al5);
        System.out.println("After retaining elements of al5 from al4 :"+ al4); 
        
        ArrayList<String> al7=new ArrayList<String>();  
        al7.add("Ravi");  
        al7.add("Vijay");  
        al7.add("Ajay");  
        ArrayList<String> al8=new ArrayList<String>();  
        al8.add("Ravi");  
        al8.add("Hanumat");  

        al7.retainAll(al8);  
        System.out.println(al7);

        //Empty  - check whether the list is empty or not !!!
         
        System.out.println("Is ArrayList Empty: "+al4.isEmpty()); 
        System.out.println("Is ArrayList Empty: "+al5.isEmpty()); 
       
	}

}
